doc.after: The epistemic merit model is a method for understanding propaganda conceived by Sheryl Tuttle Ross and detailed in her 2002 article for the Journal of Aesthetic Education entitled Understanding Propaganda The Epistemic Merit Model and Its Application to Art 16 Ross developed the Epistemic merit model due to concern about narrow misleading definitions of propaganda She contrasted her model with the ideas of Pope Gregory XV the Institute for Propaganda Analysis Alfred Lee F C Bartlett and Hans Speier Insisting that each of their respective discussions of propaganda are too narrow Ross proposed her own definition
